intro: Coccoloba caravellae, commonly known as the Caribbean beauty leaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean region, including parts of the Bahamas, Cuba, and the Greater Antilles. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often brightly colored, ranging from red to green. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to salty air and sandy soils. Coccoloba caravellae is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
